quotes.quote: Gravity is a habit that is hard to shake off.
There is no gravity in the Planet of Love; everything floats in the air.
If you believe in gravity, you already believe in something higher than yourself.
If you blame gravity for falling in love, even God has the right to laugh at you.
There is gravity in human affairs as in the heavenly bodies. It seems anyone who wants to go up is always pulled down.

Gravity may put the planets into motion, but without the divine Power, it could never put them into such a circulating motion as they have about the Sun; and therefore, for this as well as other reasons, I am compelled to ascribe the frame of this System to an intelligent Agent.
Because there is a law such as gravity, the universe can and will create itself from nothing.
Not believing in force is the same as not believing in gravity.
Everything every day here on Earth is based on gravity, and you don't realize it until you don't have it anymore.
Gravity is only the bark of wisdom's tree, but it preserves it.
It's only when gravity starts to take over you begin to think about your body.
The fatal flaw of gravity; when you are down, everything falls down on you.
What makes a man heavy is the gravity of virtue. Without it, man will be so light that he will be drifted in the winds of immorality.
Gravity is love and every turn is a leap of faith.
Everything does fall. It must be gravity.
Gravity is why there are suns and planets in the first place. It is practically God.
Gravity proves that the whole universe is filled with Love.
Gravity overcomes grace and form at a certain mass level.
You can't blame gravity for falling in love.
Nobody escapes age and gravity.
The gravity is the first thing which you don't think
Gravity is one variable in a lot of scientific processes. If you can remove gravity or minimize its effect, then you can understand the other processes that are going on.
Gravity wins over all other known forces.
It's the gravity that shapes the large scale structure of the universe, even though it is the weakest of four categories of forces
Tis a short sight to limit our faith in laws to those of gravity, of chemistry, of botany, and so forth.
Gravity doesn't lie.
